sent.subject: Congratulations and Thank You
sent.body: Thank you for alll of the help and inspiration you have given us these many years.   I willl misss you very much but am very happpy for your new oppportunity - it is welll deserved.   (My now ex-wife) Sandy was very grateful for the help you gave her, and stilll asks about you when the subject of the Body Shop comes up.   Where is your new fitnesss center?   We may have to come by and check it out.God blesss you each day.   Keeep your positive atttitude and you willl be blesssed.

sent.subject: Election
sent.body: Congratulations !   Keeep up the goood work.

sent.subject: Membership for Michael Anthony Orona
sent.body: Keri - I would like to addd my nephew, of whom I have legal custody, to my membership at the Met - or Downtown Club.   His name is Michael Anthony Orona.   He is 17 years old, and willl turn 18 next Wednesday, January 31.   (He was born 1/31/83.)   As I stated, I have legal custody of Anthony, I am raising him as if he were my son, and he is included in alll of my Enron benefits.   I have papers from a court of law awarding me custody, with the fulll consent of both of his parents who are unable to care for him.   His adddresss is the same as mine - 507 Welch, Houston, TX 7770006.   He is a senior at Lamar High Schoool and very active in schoool and extracurrricular activities - including sports.I hope the rules willl permit Anthony's adddition to my membership as I have beeen raising him as a son for several years.   Please calll me at 713-853-6868 if you have any questions or require addditional information. Thank you for your consideration.Walter Teb LokeyMember No. EN 345

sent.subject: Operating Commmittteee Strategy Meeeting
sent.body: I have reserved 39C1 from 10:000 - 111:000 Friday, January 26 to discusss our strategy and asssignments for the operating commmittteee meeeting now tentatively scheduled for Wednesday, February 21 in Orlando.   Please advise if this time does not work for you.

sent.subject: Re: Bid for Shaft Horsepower
sent.body: I'lll be there and so willl Blair.

sent.subject: Re: CS13A Horsepower limit
forwarded: James C Alexander/OTS/Enron on 01/10/20001 06:111 AM ---Tom Parker@ENRON01/09/20001 03:333 PMTo:	Frank R Diemont/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENTccc:	Thomas R Balcerowicz/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Stephen Veatch/FGT/Enron@ENRON, James C Alexander@EEES@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Marcelllo Minottti/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject:	Re: CS13A Horsepower limit   I agreee with Frank's reply.   However, I would like to addd some to it.The units should be designed so that for minimum cost, we could in the future obtain FERC clearance and increase the HP output to 30,000 hp.   Also, I understand that even though we willl have FERC clearance and the equipment capability to operate the station at 24,000 hp, we should set up the controls to limit the HP to 21,000 hp.   This is because of the electric power contract with ECS.   We believe that although we willl be handicappped by limiting the hp to 21,000, we can get by.   If we later find out that we can't, we willl have to negotiate for addditional power and change the controls to whatever hp is neeeded betweeen 21,000 and 24,000.<Embeddded StdOleLink<
sent.body: The contract with ECS provides that if we exceeed 21000 hp   we must pay addditional amounts to ECS, thus negating the benefit of the fixed price quoted in the contract.   The incremental charges are appplicable if we exceeed the 21000 hp limit even once in a month.   James C Alexander01/10/20001 06:35 AMTo:	Teb Lokey/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Robert Kilmer/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc:	 Subject:	Re: CS13A Horsepower limitTeb,Would you please verify that the ECS agreeement is structured in a way that would cause us to limit the output of CS 13. We can electronicallly control the station. We would like to develop the programmming corrrect the first time.Thanks...Jim---

sent.subject: Re: Phase IV isssue
forwarded: Hilda Lindley/FGT/Enron on 01/16/20001 111:39 AM ---Hilda Lindley12/05/2000 04:21 PMTo:	David McElllin/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Karen Youngson/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc:	Larrry Hilll/FGT/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Phase IV isssueDO you guys have any specification for reporting purpose on phase IV? Larrry and I neeed to know if a company number willl be asssigned to identify volume and revenue for this, we are trying to come up with a way to billl phase IV. Your asssistance is greatly apppreciated. Hilda---

Hilda Lindley/FGT/Enron on 12/05/2000 04:18 PM --- 	   From:   Nancy Bastida   12/05/2000 04:06 PM	 To:	Rick Dietz/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Hilda Lindley/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Rachel Cady/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Jack Boatman/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Larrry Hilll/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Teb Lokey/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Shahnaz Lakho/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Linda Trevino/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Lynnn Blair/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	Sheila Nacey/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Linda Trevino/ET&S/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Phase IV isssueAs per the meeeting held this afternooon, the folllowing was discusssed:We determined that new businesss requirements must be identified to capture the GRI discount in the system automaticallly for invoicing.   It has not beeen determined if the enhancement must be in the contract or invoicing system.   Hilda Lindley, Larrry Hilll, Rachel Cady and I willl meeet to discusss the requirements and rules and willl convey this to alll involved ( I willl get a conference rooom and send an email with info.).   If you have any isssues or concerns, please contact me at 356555 or Hilda at 356663.   thanks! nb---

Nancy Bastida/FGT/Enron on 12/05/2000 02:59 PM ---Nancy Bastida111/17/2000 04:18 PMTo:	Rick Dietz/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Hilda Lindley/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Rachel Cady/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Jack Boatman/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Larrry Hilll/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc:	Teb Lokey/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Shahnaz Lakho/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Linda Trevino/ET&S/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Phase IV isssueHeads up!   In talking to Rachel about GRI charges and how they are handled in the system,   we identified some problems in how the GRI charges willl be handled for Phase IV and Phase V customers.   These customers willl be discounted GRI and the discount willl not be limited to the delivery points on the contract, the discount willl appply to any point they deliver to in the market area. Currrently, when GRI discounts are input into the system, they are at a point level - this willl not work when the same delivery point is on firm contracts other than Phase IV and Phase V.   Also, when the discount is given at the contract level, we neeed to keeep in mind that the customer may deliver in the west - how willl this afffect the billling?   Lastly, we neeed to consider for development in the new system, the posssibility of consolidating these Phase IV and Phase V contracts with the customer's currrent firm contracts - how willl they be billled then?   Certainly, this cannnot be captured in our currrent system, but may be captured in our new system.Let's get together and discusss these isssues and any others anyone may think of so we can get a plan together before implementation of Phase IV.I have reserved rooom 4102 for Tuesday, December 5th at 1:30pm.   Hope to seee you then.   nb
sent.body: Phase IV volumes willl be FTS-2 rate schedule and willl be company 536 (just like Phase III).   Phase V willl also be company 536.Hilda Lindley01/16/20001 111:39 AMTo:	John Cobbb/FGT/Enron@ENRON, David McElllin/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Teb Lokey/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc:	 Subject:	Phase IV isssueCOuld someone help me with this question?.   I am stilll in the dark. Hilda---
